intro: Emurtia emarginata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved emurtia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves with a distinctive notched or lobed margin. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in inflorescences. Emurtia emarginata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
